availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Spencer County, Kentucky, surveyor and legislator. Spencer County native. Son of John Cochran and Hannah Van Buskirk Cochran. Graduated from the Kentucky Military Institute in Frankfort, Kentucky, in 1849. Married Julia C. Owen Cochran in 1854. Farmer and county surveyor in Spencer County. Owned four enslaved people in Spencer County in 1860. Represented Spencer County in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1861 to 1863. Raised a company of the Kentucky State Guard for ninety day service in 1862.

bibl.p: Josiah Stoddard Johnston, Memorial History of Louisville from its First Settlement of the Year 1896 Vol 1 (Louisville: American Biographical Publishing Company, 1896), 444; Find A Grave, "Robert Cochran (1829 - 1902)," Memorial #98350450, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=cochran&GSfn=robert&GSby=1829&GSbyrel=in&GSdyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=98350450&df=all& (accessed September 11, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, Division No. 2, p. 11.
